snippet: In many states under single-party control, lawmakers are steering away from the divisive battles on abortion, gun control, collective bargaining and large tax cuts that have marked recent sessions in state capitols.
abstract: Lawmakers in many states under single-party control are steering away from divisive battles on abortion, gun control, collective bargaining and large tax cuts that have marked recent sessions in state capitols; move reflects political concerns among some legislators and governors up for election that they at times had claimed an unfounded mandate with this aggressive period of legislating (Series: One-Party Rule).

byline.contributor: Monica Davey and Steven Yaccino contributed reporting from Chicago.

lead_paragraph: In many states under single-party control, lawmakers are steering away from the divisive battles on abortion, gun control, collective bargaining and large tax cuts that have marked recent sessions in state capitols.

headline.main: After Flurry of Changes, Some States Ease Up
headline.print_headline: After Flurry of Changes, Some States Ease Up
